result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert James Rampalski

records.addlTxt: Court REINSTATES Justice Point supervision at the previous level. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Robert James Rampalski in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Robert James Rampalski.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/9/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9.28.22, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 9.19.22, filed.

Defendant Robert James Rampalski in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Robert James Rampalski.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.14.22, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 9.6.22, filed.

Defendant Robert James Rampalski in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defense counsel withdraws bail modification request, due to reasons put forth on the record. Defense further informs court that they are still awaiting discovery materials, and requests a Scheduling Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.10.22, filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.M. (DOB: 2/9/73).
DECLINED, filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause.  As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Robert James Rampalski in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Robert James Rampalski in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Return on doctor's report held. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court proceeds to an initial appearance.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed.
filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Robert James Rampalski in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Robert James Rampalski in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert James Rampalski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
